conclusion: Analyze forces on the rod due to springs and magnetic field to find elongation.
Metal rod AB is suspended by springs in a magnetic field perpendicular to the paper.
Current I1 from a to b results in zero magnetic force due to symmetry.
Springs are balanced by the rod's weight when not stretched.
Current I2 from b to a causes magnetic force F = BIL on the rod.
Force F causes rod movement and spring stretching to balance force.
Elongation x of springs is given by F = 2kx.
Solving for x gives x = BIL/2k.
The elongation of the springs is BIL/2k.
